1.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

2.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to balance, i.e. measure out (by weight or dimension); figuratively, arrange, equalize, through the idea of levelling (ment. estimate, test)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

3.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)

4.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated

to cover (specifically with bitumen); figuratively, to expiate or condone, to placate or cancel
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

7.brief: to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt

properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse

properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
